fields.reasoning: A visible error container displayed the message “Name — This is not a valid Name.” providing textual feedback in addition to red styling; not color-only. Note: message not programmatically linked to the field.
Error text “Email — This is not a valid Email-Id.” (plus browser hint) provides textual feedback alongside red styling; not color-only. Note: not programmatically linked to the field.
Error text “Subject — Subject should be minimum of 6 characters.” provides textual feedback; despite red styling, error is not color-only. Note: not programmatically linked to the field.

No error cues (color or otherwise) were directly tied to the Name field after invalid input. No validation feedback was triggered.

---

A red-colored error message ("Inclua um '@'...") appeared, but the error is not conveyed by color alone—textual content is present. Thus, it passes WCAG 1.4.1.

---

No error cues or validation feedback were triggered for the Subject field.
